website_summaries.verdict: The Samsung Restore is a great eco-friendly option if you want a full-featured multimedia messaging phone on Sprint.
pros: The Samsung Restore is made out of recyclable materials, has a solid slider design, and includes features such as a 2.0-megapixel camera, a music player, a 3.5mm headset jack, and EV-DO Rev
cons: The Samsung Restore's camera doesn't take very good pictures and its call quality needs to be improved

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave this product a 4 star rating was because the letters on the keyboard low and are hard to push. Otherwise a good value
customer_reviews.author: nikya2000

customer_reviews.title: I like this retro phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is well built. Shiny and does what I needed it for. I like how it can accept a 16GB microsd card. also has a simple speech voice for reading text messages.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: better than basic
customer_reviews.text: it was easy to activate.....virgin mobile makes it difficult..but not with this handset it takes pretty good pictures.Has nice loud ring tones. however the reception could be better and the buttons could function better I'm not completley satisfied with the performance ,however i believe the mountians I live around have alot to do with it!
customer_reviews.author: kimberly ditlefsen

customer_reviews.title: M575phone
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to up date my phone without getting to complicated. I did it with this phone. It works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: busybee47

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I expected...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with what it is, don't think about what it isn't. I got more than I paid for so I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Bellini

customer_reviews.title: Not the best choice.
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung phone arrived on time and in good shape. However, I am disappointed with several of the features, notably the auto key-lock. When I enable the auto keylock feature, the keyboard locks up permanently and I had to remove the battery twice to re-enable keying. With the auto lock disabled, the key-lock feature only works occasionally and frequently the keys get pressed unintentionally. Had I known this up front, I would not have bought this phone. Two stars is charitable!
customer_reviews.author: L. W. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Everything arrived on time undamaged and in perfect conditions I love this product. I am very satisfied with it. I use it every day and works amazingly well. People keep complementing me on it.
customer_reviews.author: yuli

customer_reviews.title: a good phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: The phone performs very well. It is a good cellphone for use with a Virgin Mobile pre-paid plan or for any type of monthly plan.
customer_reviews.author: Channelcat

customer_reviews.title: samsung m575
customer_reviews.text: can I change this item?its hard to call & contact somebody...same thing with my old cellphone..did not ring properly...they can't contact me...
customer_reviews.author: Emil Alcantara

customer_reviews.title: Worst Phone Ever
customer_reviews.text: I just sent my M575 back today. It had very poor voice quality -- my friends said it sounded cheap, tinny and distant. By comparison my inexpensive Samsung Entro has the best voice quality my friends have ever heard. The screen was large but the text was so small you almost had to have reading glasses on to see it. It was very hard to customize as none of my PICTs from the SD chip were acceptable (but they were on 3 other phones) and I was able to transfers MP3 sounds but could only listen to them and not use them as ring tones. Not my kind of phone. Miss my Motorola RAZR. Craig
customer_reviews.author: Craig N. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: decent phone
customer_reviews.text: I like the pullout qwerty keyboard, and data and web access (a very small amount). The amount of minutes and texting is enough for my needs. The phone itself is decent. Pretty sturdy, relatively easy to understand on the other end. There certainly are better quality phones out there, but for what I paid, I'm happy. I'm still trying to figure out some features though.
customer_reviews.author: hollydaze2

customer_reviews.title: Simple, compact, and dependable!
customer_reviews.text: I no longer use this cellphone but it was compact, dependable, and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Tracy L. Haggins

customer_reviews.title: Great little "almost smart" phone!
customer_reviews.text: Its a very nice little "almost smart" phone with GPS, browse, E-mail etc. Its not an Android our I-phone, but it doesn't cost that much either and it does get the Nov done.
customer_reviews.author: Charly gilland

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great upgrade for those of us that have an Obama phone. The phone comes with a bunch of nice pre-loaded functions. It has really good battery life too.
customer_reviews.author: William Serocki

customer_reviews.title: cute little phone for my 11 year old son :)
customer_reviews.text: My son will soon be 12, but this phone was a nice little starter phone for him. I said maybe when he's 13 I'll get him a "smart" phone (he can just enjoy his laptop in the meantime:)
customer_reviews.author: Kennly Madell

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great phone and easy to use and the rate package are very affordable the coverage its good thank you again.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Call and text
customer_reviews.text: Was a "high end" phone in its day especially for Tmobile but is nothing to really talk about today. But to Virgin mobile it is still the phone to go to if you are on the PayLo plan.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Fun

customer_reviews.title: great phone
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life, easy to use, slider is easy to use but the phone is heavy. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: I May Have Made a Mistake
customer_reviews.text: This phone is terrible. I had an old flip phone for 7 years that worked way better than the Samsung M575. It has a hard time sending texts. It also takes a long time to connect calls, and when talking, the person's voice goes in and out. It is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Samsung M575
customer_reviews.text: I am not impressed. I am alreday on the second phone after I just bought the first one in Sept 12. The keyboard keeps locking up and the key lock does not appear to be reliable either . Frankly I have no desire to reset the phone once or twice a day by taking the battery out ....if this was a car, I would consider this phone model a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Barhuf

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was good, until time refuses to reset off of DST and other glictches.
customer_reviews.text: Took out battery, reinstalled. Emailed Virgin Mobile, no answer save for an automated reply that said I'd hear from them within 48 hours. Never did. Reset 'world time'. Still showing wrong time. Called provider twice, each time they reset from office with my battery out of phone. Still no help. I was basically told I'm SOL! Phone is ok, but has other glitches as well, including not removing nor clearing message icon once all voicemails have been listened to, deleted, and the button has been reset. A real POS.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brochin

product_meta.title: Samsung M575 Prepaid Phone (payLo by Virgin Mobile)
product_meta.description:
The Samsung SPH-M575 is a CDMA 3G cell phone featuring 2-megapixel camera, slide-out QWERTY keyboard, optical trackpad for enhanced navigation, Sprint's OneClick interface, Facebook, Twitter, MP3 player, and stereo Bluetooth compatibility. The M575 is also equipped with GPS, microSD memory card slot, and support for multiple languages including Spanish. This is an excellent messaging device with great sound quality. 





AMAZON.COM


This compact phone fits easily into your pocket or purse. The Samsung M575 comes with a full QWERTY keyboard, with four rows of keys and one letter per key. It slides out from the body of the phone. The buttons are easy to use for fast messaging and a great gaming experience. Once you're through typing, the keyboard slides away conveniently.

(view larger). 

(view larger). The 2.4" QVGA screen has a 320 X 240 display resolution which is great for gaming, looking at maps or easy browsing of your phone. 

Take fun pictures anywhere and easily post them to your favorite social networking site or email them to friends. If you love social networking, the Samsung M575 sets a new standard for sharing your status and stories. 

Get GPS directions on your screen so you won't ever get lost again. You will not want to leave your house or visit a new part of town without your Samsung M575.

KEY FEATURES AND SPECS
(view larger).  * 2.4-inch LCD display 
 * Slider QWERTY with 4-row keyboard 
 * 2-megapixel camera with video. 
 * 600 Mhz processor means higher-quality graphics and faster performance 
 * Bluetooth 2.1 connectivity 
 * Memory expansion via microSD card slot with support for optional cards up to 32 GB 
 * 128 MB internal memory 
 * Messaging via text, video, picture, and instant messaging 
 * Navigation with Google Maps and Virgin Navigator 
 * Web browser with Opera mini 
 * E-mail access 
 * Organizer tools including calendar, alarm clock, memo, calculator, and stopwatch. 
 * Speakerphone for hands-free communication. 
 * 3.5mm headphone jack 
 * Hearing aid compatibility = M4/T3. 

VITAL STATISTICS
The Samsung M575 weighs 3.7 ounces and measures 4.6 x 2.1 x 0.6 inches. Its 1140 mAh lithium-ion battery is rated at up to 4 hours of talk time and 17 days of standby time. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Samsung M575 handset, 1140 mAh lithium-ion battery, charger, printed materials






PayLo Talk & Text Plans. VIRGIN MOBILE PREPAID PRICING
With Virgin Mobile's PayLo plans, you can pay only for the calling time you use. You can easily Top-Up your Virgin Mobile account right from your phone. First, buy a Top-Up card at one of the thousands of retailers that carry them; or register your debit card, credit card, or PayPal account at the Virgin Mobile USA web site in order to add minutes to your account directly from your phone.

Virgin Mobile customers have access to the Sprint Nationwide Network, reaching more than 278 million people across the United States (see a map of Virgin Mobile's coverage area).
